Computer Lab                              search the site                                                                                  VCL login »      Read more about the VCL: 7 Things to Know About the Virtual Computer Lab                               The Virtual Computer Lab (VCL) provides access to academic software through a web browser and an Internet connection. Available 24 hours a day, seven days a week, the VCL is a revolutionary way to provide NYU students with access to the software they need.      Access & Eligibility   The VCL is open to all degree-seeking NYU students with active NYU Email accounts. Students who qualify will see the VCL channel on the Academics tab in NYUHome. See Accessing the VCL for login and setup instructions.   Available Software   For a current list of software available for use via the Virtual Computer Lab, please see the ITS Software Applications by Location page.    Help & Instructions   The ServiceLink knowledge base contains a variety of FAQs and instructions to support the use of the VCL. If you are unable to find an answer to your question, please contact the IT Service Desk .   Installation and configuration       System requirements    Installing the Citrix plug-in (Mac)    Installing the Citrix plug-in (Windows)    Installing the Citrix plug-in (mobile devices)    Checking that the Citrix plug-in is installed       Instructions for use       Printing documents from VCL applications    Saving files    Submitting suggestions and improvements       Troubleshooting       File security alert when opening an application    Session times out    Two Print dialog boxes appear when printing from Mac    Unable to log in to the VCL and other password issues    Asked to allow access to mapped drive when saving file    Being asked to install the Citrix plugin, but it is already installed       Click here to browse more VCL knowledgebase solutions »     Page last reviewed: July 31, 2014
